alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. Sometimes I cook dinner or lunch, depending on what I have around. Very often it's a cake. And in that case here, I had a can of dark kidney beans and other things. I'm going to do a stew with it. Starting with like a tablespoon of olive oil here. And I'm going to put some lardons in it. What we call lardons in French, L-A-R-D-O-N, which is Little diced pancetta. That is, it's like the same cut done bacon, but it's not smoked. If you want to use bacon in there, it's perfectly fine. You can use bacon instead of that. I put a third of a cup, which is about an ounce and a half. And I'm going to saute this with half a cup of onion. Very nicely sharpening. Okay. Okay. It's browning a little bit here. Nicely. So 2, 3 minutes. We'll put the onion, I'm going to go with it. And 1, 2 cloves of garlic. Crush it first, and then cut it. Chop it coarsely. And maybe the garlic. I think I need a little more oil, so I would put probably 2 tablespoon to start with. And here I have a pepper, which sometimes is hot, sometimes it's not. It's a poblano pepper, and the poblano pepper, Sometimes you test it, it's really pretty hot. Some of the time it's not. So here, I will cut it coarsely. In there. Okay. I will add to it. Beautiful color. And then in there probably half a cup of diced tomato. And I usually use Italian diced tomato. Very good, half a cup. And my red beans. I'm gonna pour some of the water out, about half of it. I still keep some in there. Have the stew here. You want to taste it. A little bit of salt. Yeah, you want them to cook for 5 minutes so the pepper is cooked and the onion and so forth. I'm going to put some cilantro at the end. When I buy cilantro, very often I buy the bunch of cilantro. I cut the front, the leaves. I use them within 1 or 2 days. And the rest of it, like this 1 here, I put that in the freezer. And this has a lot of taste, the stem. So when you cut it here, it kind of crumbles. It kind of crumbles into. But I always, when I do, especially stew of beans, I use cilantro, a lot of it. Then I use the stem. It has as much taste as the leaf, if not more. I'm putting that in there. And this is it. You can put your pan right in the middle of the table or put it into a dish like this. Can 1 or the other, but it is a beautiful stew. Be great with a grilled pork chop or a steak or a piece of chicken. Stew of red beans. Happy cooking.

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. Sometimes I cook dinner or lunch, depending on what I have around. Very often it's a cake. And in that case here, I had a can of dark kidney beans and other things. I'm going to do a stew with it.

Starting with like a tablespoon of olive oil here. And I'm going to put some lardons in it. What we call lardons in French, L-A-R-D-O-N, which is Little diced pancetta. That is, it's like the same cut done bacon, but it's not smoked. If you want to use bacon in there, it's perfectly fine.

You can use bacon instead of that. I put a third of a cup, which is about an ounce and a half. And I'm going to saute this with half a cup of onion. Very nicely sharpening. Okay.

Okay. It's browning a little bit here. Nicely. So 2, 3 minutes. We'll put the onion, I'm going to go with it.

And 1, 2 cloves of garlic. Crush it first, and then cut it. Chop it coarsely. And maybe the garlic. I think I need a little more oil, so I would put probably 2 tablespoon to start with.

And here I have a pepper, which sometimes is hot, sometimes it's not. It's a poblano pepper, and the poblano pepper, Sometimes you test it, it's really pretty hot. Some of the time it's not. So here, I will cut it coarsely. In there.

Okay. I will add to it. Beautiful color. And then in there probably half a cup of diced tomato. And I usually use Italian diced tomato.

Very good, half a cup. And my red beans. I'm gonna pour some of the water out, about half of it. I still keep some in there. Have the stew here.

You want to taste it. A little bit of salt. Yeah, you want them to cook for 5 minutes so the pepper is cooked and the onion and so forth. I'm going to put some cilantro at the end. When I buy cilantro, very often I buy the bunch of cilantro.

I cut the front, the leaves. I use them within 1 or 2 days. And the rest of it, like this 1 here, I put that in the freezer. And this has a lot of taste, the stem. So when you cut it here, it kind of crumbles.

It kind of crumbles into. But I always, when I do, especially stew of beans, I use cilantro, a lot of it. Then I use the stem. It has as much taste as the leaf, if not more. I'm putting that in there.

And this is it. You can put your pan right in the middle of the table or put it into a dish like this. Can 1 or the other, but it is a beautiful stew. Be great with a grilled pork chop or a steak or a piece of chicken. Stew of red beans.

Happy cooking.

Very often it's a cake.
And in that case here, I had a can of dark kidney beans and other things.
I'm going to do a stew with it.

And I'm going to put some lardons in it.

And I'm going to saute this with half a cup of onion.
Very nicely sharpening.

And 1, 2 cloves of garlic.

Chop it coarsely.

And here I have a pepper, which sometimes is hot, sometimes it's not.
It's a poblano pepper, and the poblano pepper, Sometimes you test it, it's really pretty hot.
Some of the time it's not.
So here, I will cut it coarsely.
In there.

I'm going to put some cilantro at the end.

And the rest of it, like this 1 here, I put that in the freezer.
